trans-unit.source: Scale a web app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Scale a web app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Learn how to scale up and scale out a web app in Azure App Service, including autoscaling.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to scale up and scale out a web app in Azure App Service, including autoscaling.

trans-unit.source: Scale a web app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Scale a web app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: For increased performance and throughput for your web apps on Microsoft Azure, you can use the Azure Portal to scale your App Service plan from Free mode to Shared, Basic, Standard, or Premium mode.
trans-unit.target: For increased performance and throughput for your web apps on Microsoft Azure, you can use the Azure Portal to scale your App Service plan from Free mode to Shared, Basic, Standard, or Premium mode.

trans-unit.source: Scaling up on Azure web apps involves two related actions: changing your App Service plan mode to a higher level of service, and configuring certain settings after you have switched to the higher level of service.
trans-unit.target: Scaling up on Azure web apps involves two related actions: changing your App Service plan mode to a higher level of service, and configuring certain settings after you have switched to the higher level of service.

trans-unit.source: Both topics are covered in this article.
trans-unit.target: Both topics are covered in this article.

trans-unit.source: Higher service tiers like Standard and Premium modes offer greater robustness and flexibility in determining how your resources on Azure are used.
trans-unit.target: Higher service tiers like Standard and Premium modes offer greater robustness and flexibility in determining how your resources on Azure are used.

trans-unit.source: Changing modes and configuring them is easily done in the Scale tab of the management portal.
trans-unit.target: Changing modes and configuring them is easily done in the Scale tab of the management portal.

trans-unit.source: You can scale up or down as required.
trans-unit.target: You can scale up or down as required.

trans-unit.source: These changes take only seconds to apply and affect all web apps in your App Service plan.
trans-unit.target: These changes take only seconds to apply and affect all web apps in your App Service plan.

trans-unit.source: They do not require your code to be changed or your applications to be redeployed.
trans-unit.target: They do not require your code to be changed or your applications to be redeployed.

trans-unit.source: For information about App Service plans, see <link><linkText>What is an App Service Plan?</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Azure App Service Plans In-Depth Overview</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about App Service plans, see <link><linkText>What is an App Service Plan?</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Azure App Service Plans In-Depth Overview</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For information the pricing and features of individual App Service plans, see <link><linkText>App Service Pricing Details</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information the pricing and features of individual App Service plans, see <link><linkText>App Service Pricing Details</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Before switching a web app from the Free mode to Basic, Standard, or Premium mode, you must first remove the spending caps in place for your Azure App Service subscription.
trans-unit.target: Before switching a web app from the Free mode to Basic, Standard, or Premium mode, you must first remove the spending caps in place for your Azure App Service subscription.

trans-unit.source: To view or change options for your Microsoft Azure App Service subscription, see <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure Subscriptions[azuresubscriptions]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To view or change options for your Microsoft Azure App Service subscription, see <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure Subscriptions[azuresubscriptions]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Scaling to Shared or Basic mode
trans-unit.target: Scaling to Shared or Basic mode

trans-unit.source: In your browser, open the <link><linkText>Azure Portal[portal]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: In your browser, open the <link><linkText>Azure Portal[portal]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In your web app's blade, click All settings, then click Scale, then click Upgrade from a Free plan to add instances and get better performance.
trans-unit.target: In your web app's blade, click All settings, then click Scale, then click Upgrade from a Free plan to add instances and get better performance.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Choose Plan</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Choose Plan</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Choose your pricing tier blade, choose either Shared or a Basic mode, then click Select.
trans-unit.target: In the Choose your pricing tier blade, choose either Shared or a Basic mode, then click Select.

trans-unit.source: The Notifications tab will flash a green SUCCESS once the operation is complete.
trans-unit.target: The Notifications tab will flash a green SUCCESS once the operation is complete.

trans-unit.source: Slide the Instance bar from left to right to increase the number of instances, then click Save in the command bar.
trans-unit.target: Slide the Instance bar from left to right to increase the number of instances, then click Save in the command bar.

trans-unit.source: The instance size option is not available in Shared mode.
trans-unit.target: The instance size option is not available in Shared mode.

trans-unit.source: For more information about these instance sizes, see <link><linkText>Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Microsoft Azure[vmsizes]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about these instance sizes, see <link><linkText>Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Microsoft Azure[vmsizes]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Instance size for Basic mode</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Instance size for Basic mode</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The Notifications tab will flash a green SUCCESS once the operation is complete.
trans-unit.target: The Notifications tab will flash a green SUCCESS once the operation is complete.

trans-unit.source: Scaling to Standard or Premium mode
trans-unit.target: Scaling to Standard or Premium mode

trans-unit.source: Before switching an App Service plan to Standard or Premium mode, you should remove spending caps in place for your Microsoft Azure App Service subscription.
trans-unit.target: Before switching an App Service plan to Standard or Premium mode, you should remove spending caps in place for your Microsoft Azure App Service subscription.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, you risk your web app becoming unavailable if you reach your caps before the billing period ends.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, you risk your web app becoming unavailable if you reach your caps before the billing period ends.

trans-unit.source: To view or change options for your Microsoft Azure App Service subscription, see <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure Subscriptions[azuresubscriptions]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To view or change options for your Microsoft Azure App Service subscription, see <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure Subscriptions[azuresubscriptions]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To scale to Standard or Premium mode, follow the same initial steps as when scaling to Shared or Basic, and then choose a Standard or Premium mode in Choose your pricing tier, then click Select.
trans-unit.target: To scale to Standard or Premium mode, follow the same initial steps as when scaling to Shared or Basic, and then choose a Standard or Premium mode in Choose your pricing tier, then click Select.

trans-unit.source: The Notifications tab will flash a green SUCCESS once the operation is complete, and Autoscale Mode will be enabled.
trans-unit.target: The Notifications tab will flash a green SUCCESS once the operation is complete, and Autoscale Mode will be enabled.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scale in Standard or Premium Mode</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scale in Standard or Premium Mode</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can still slide the Instance bar to manually scale to more instances, just like in Basic mode as shown above.
trans-unit.target: You can still slide the Instance bar to manually scale to more instances, just like in Basic mode as shown above.

trans-unit.source: However, here you will learn how to use Autoscale Mode.
trans-unit.target: However, here you will learn how to use Autoscale Mode.

trans-unit.source: In Autoscale Mode, select Performance to autoscale based on performance metrics.
trans-unit.target: In Autoscale Mode, select Performance to autoscale based on performance metrics.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Autoscale Mode set to Performance</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Autoscale Mode set to Performance</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In Instance Range, move the two sliders to define the minimum and maximum number of instances to scale automatically for the App Service plan.
trans-unit.target: In Instance Range, move the two sliders to define the minimum and maximum number of instances to scale automatically for the App Service plan.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, move the maximum slider to 6 instances.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, move the maximum slider to 6 instances.

trans-unit.source: Click Save in the command bar.
trans-unit.target: Click Save in the command bar.

trans-unit.source: Under Target Metrics, click > to configure autoscaling rules for the default metric.
trans-unit.target: Under Target Metrics, click > to configure autoscaling rules for the default metric.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Set Target Metrics</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Set Target Metrics</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can configure autoscaling rules for different performance metrics, including CPU, memory, disk queue, HTTP queue, and data flow.
trans-unit.target: You can configure autoscaling rules for different performance metrics, including CPU, memory, disk queue, HTTP queue, and data flow.

trans-unit.source: Here, you will configure autoscaling for CPU percentage that does the following:
trans-unit.target: Here, you will configure autoscaling for CPU percentage that does the following:

trans-unit.source: Scale up by 1 instance if CPU is above 70% in the last 10 minutes
trans-unit.target: Scale up by 1 instance if CPU is above 70% in the last 10 minutes

trans-unit.source: Scale up by 3 instances if CPU is above 90% in the last 5 minutes
trans-unit.target: Scale up by 3 instances if CPU is above 90% in the last 5 minutes

trans-unit.source: Scale down by 1 instance if CPU is below 50% in the last 30 minutes
trans-unit.target: Scale down by 1 instance if CPU is below 50% in the last 30 minutes

trans-unit.source: Leave Metric dropdown as CPU Percentage.
trans-unit.target: Leave Metric dropdown as CPU Percentage.

trans-unit.source: In Scale up rules, configure the first rule by setting Condition to Greater, Threshold to 70 (%), Over past to 10 (minutes), Scale up by to 1 (instance), and Cool down to 10 (minutes).
trans-unit.target: In Scale up rules, configure the first rule by setting Condition to Greater, Threshold to 70 (%), Over past to 10 (minutes), Scale up by to 1 (instance), and Cool down to 10 (minutes).

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Set First Autoscale Rule</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Set First Autoscale Rule</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The Cool down setting specifies how long this rule should wait after the previous scale action to scale again.
trans-unit.target: The Cool down setting specifies how long this rule should wait after the previous scale action to scale again.

trans-unit.source: Click Add Scale Up Rule, then configure the second rule by setting Condition to Greater, Threshold to 90 (%), Over past to 1 (minutes), Scale up by to 3 (instance), and Cool down to 1 (minutes).
trans-unit.target: Click Add Scale Up Rule, then configure the second rule by setting Condition to Greater, Threshold to 90 (%), Over past to 1 (minutes), Scale up by to 3 (instance), and Cool down to 1 (minutes).

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Set Second Autoscale Rule</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Set Second Autoscale Rule</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In Scale down rules, configure the third rule by setting Condition to Less, Threshold to 50 (%), Over past to 30 (minutes), Scale down by to 1 (instance), and Cool down to 60 (minutes).
trans-unit.target: In Scale down rules, configure the third rule by setting Condition to Less, Threshold to 50 (%), Over past to 30 (minutes), Scale down by to 1 (instance), and Cool down to 60 (minutes).

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Set Third Autoscale Rule</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Set Third Autoscale Rule</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Save in the command bar.
trans-unit.target: Click Save in the command bar.

trans-unit.source: Your autoscale rule should now be reflected in the Scale blade.
trans-unit.target: Your autoscale rule should now be reflected in the Scale blade.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Set Autoscale Rule Result</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Set Autoscale Rule Result</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Scaling a SQL Server Database connected to your web app
trans-unit.target: Scaling a SQL Server Database connected to your web app

trans-unit.source: If you have one or more SQL Server databases linked to your web app (regardless of App Service plan mode), you can quickly scale them based on your needs.
trans-unit.target: If you have one or more SQL Server databases linked to your web app (regardless of App Service plan mode), you can quickly scale them based on your needs.

trans-unit.source: To scale one of the linked databases, open your web app's blade in the <link><linkText>Azure portal[portal]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To scale one of the linked databases, open your web app's blade in the <link><linkText>Azure portal[portal]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In the Essentials collapsible dropdown, click the Resource group link.
trans-unit.target: In the Essentials collapsible dropdown, click the Resource group link.

trans-unit.source: Then, in the Summary part of the resource group blade, clicked one of the linked databases.
trans-unit.target: Then, in the Summary part of the resource group blade, clicked one of the linked databases.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Linked database</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Linked database</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In your linked SQL Database blade, click the Pricing tier part, select one of the tiers based on your performance requirement, and click Select.
trans-unit.target: In your linked SQL Database blade, click the Pricing tier part, select one of the tiers based on your performance requirement, and click Select.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scale your SQL Database</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scale your SQL Database</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can also set up geo-replication to increase the high availability and disaster recovery capabilities of your SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: You can also set up geo-replication to increase the high availability and disaster recovery capabilities of your SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: To do this, click the Geo Replication part.
trans-unit.target: To do this, click the Geo Replication part.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Set up geo-replication for SQL Database</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Set up geo-replication for SQL Database</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Developer Features
trans-unit.target: Developer Features

trans-unit.source: Depending on the web app's mode, the following developer-oriented features are available:
trans-unit.target: Depending on the web app's mode, the following developer-oriented features are available:

trans-unit.source: Bitness
trans-unit.target: Bitness

trans-unit.source: The Basic, Standard, and Premium modes support 64-bit and 32-bit applications.
trans-unit.target: The Basic, Standard, and Premium modes support 64-bit and 32-bit applications.

trans-unit.source: The Free and Shared plan modes support 32-bit applications only.
trans-unit.target: The Free and Shared plan modes support 32-bit applications only.

trans-unit.source: Debugger Support
trans-unit.target: Debugger Support

trans-unit.source: Debugger support is available for the Free, Shared, and Basic modes at 1 concurrent connection per App Service plan.
trans-unit.target: Debugger support is available for the Free, Shared, and Basic modes at 1 concurrent connection per App Service plan.

trans-unit.source: Debugger support is available for the Standard and Premium modes at 5 concurrent connections per App Service plan.
trans-unit.target: Debugger support is available for the Standard and Premium modes at 5 concurrent connections per App Service plan.

trans-unit.source: Other Features
trans-unit.target: Other Features

trans-unit.source: Web Endpoint Monitoring
trans-unit.target: Web Endpoint Monitoring

trans-unit.source: Web endpoint monitoring is available in the Basic, Standard, and Premium modes.
trans-unit.target: Web endpoint monitoring is available in the Basic, Standard, and Premium modes.

trans-unit.source: For more information about web endpoint monitoring, see <link><linkText>How to Monitor Web Apps</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about web endpoint monitoring, see <link><linkText>How to Monitor Web Apps</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For detailed information about all of the remaining features in the App Service plans, including pricing and features of interest to all users (including developers), see <link><linkText>App Service Pricing Details</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For detailed information about all of the remaining features in the App Service plans, including pricing and features of interest to all users (including developers), see <link><linkText>App Service Pricing Details</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to <link><linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title></link>, where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to <link><linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title></link>, where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.

trans-unit.target: To get started with Azure, see <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure Free Trial</linkText><title></title></link>.
